      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction SearchDenorm(IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn column)
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      Function for getting the linguistic/lower case value for the given text column (no validation is made on the column's type). NOTE: If what is required is just the database function LOWER, then use the Literal method instead.

    • Literal

      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction Literal(Object... exprs)
      Same as Literal(false, null, exprs). This can be used when the type of the expression is not known. If known, please use Literal(GWJdbcType, Object...). Note: To use a Literal expression in the select list, you must specify the GWJdbcType
      Parameters:
      exprs - Expression list
      Returns:
      a function defined by the given list of expressions.

    • Literal

      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction Literal(GWJdbcType jdbcType, Object... exprs)
      Same as Literal(false, jdbcType, exprs). This can be used when the expression does not use an aggregate function. If it does, please use Literal(boolean, GWJdbcType, Object...) and use true for the first parameter.
      Parameters:
      jdbcType - The GWJdbcType of the result of evaluating the literal
      exprs - Expression list
      Returns:
      a function defined by the given list of expressions.

    • Literal

      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction Literal(boolean isAggregate, GWJdbcType jdbcType, Object... exprs)
      Returns a function defined by the given list of expressions. An expression is a list containing either CharSequences or Numbers or Dates or Booleans or IBeforeUpgradeColumnRefs or BeforeUpgradeDBFunctions. The objects in the list will be concatenated together to form a SQL expression. For example, the following code creates a function which computes the sum of two columns. IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column1 = ... IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column2 = ... IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction columnSum = BeforeUpgradeDBFunction.Literal({column1, " + ", column2})
      Parameters:
      isAggregate - true if the expression uses an aggregate function, e.g. MAX. This is used to decide whether to generate a NOT IN or NOT EXISTS.
      jdbcType - The GWJdbcType of the result of evaluating the literal
      exprs - Expression list
      Returns:
      a function defined by the given list of expressions.

    • Concatenate

      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction Concatenate(Object... exprs)
      Returns a function that uses SQL concatenatation on the given list of expressions. An expression is a list containing either CharSequences or Numbers or IBeforeUpgradeColumnRefs or IBeforeUpgradeDBFunctions. The objects in the list will be concatenated together to form a SQL expression. For example, the following code creates a function which concatenates a column and a constant. IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column1 = ... IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction columnSum = BeforeUpgradeDBFunction.Concatenate({column1, "some constant"})
      Parameters:
      exprs - Expression list
      Returns:
      a function that uses SQL concatenatation on the given list of expressions.

    • Coalesce

      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction Coalesce(Object... exprs)
      Returns a coalesce function over the expression list. An expression is either a CharSequence or a Number or a Date or a Boolean or a IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef or a BeforeUpgradeDBFunction. Note: To use a Coalesce expression in the select list, you must specify the GWJdbcType
      Parameters:
      exprs - Expression list
      Returns:
      coalesce function for each of the given expressions, i.e. COALESCE(expr1, expr2, ...). Returns expr1 if only one expression.

    • Coalesce

      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction Coalesce(GWJdbcType jdbcType, Object... exprs)
      Returns a coalesce function over the expression list. An expression is either a CharSequence or a Number or a Date or a Boolean or a IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef or a BeforeUpgradeDBFunction.
      Parameters:
      jdbcType - The GWJdbcType of the result of evaluating the Coalesce
      exprs - Expression list
      Returns:
      coalesce function for each of the given expressions, i.e. COALESCE(expr1, expr2, ...). Returns expr1 if only one expression.

    • DateDiff

      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction DateDiff(DateDiffPart diffPart, Object startDate, Object endDate)
      Returns a DateDiff function, used to calculate the difference between two timestamps, expressed in a configurable unit of measure. Note that database difference functions do not adjust for daylight savings time. For example, if you ask for the number of hours between noon on 11/5/11 and noon on 11/6/11, you will get 24 back, even though 25 hours has elapsed.
      Parameters:
      diffPart - What DateDiffPart in which to express the difference. Answer cannot overflow an integer.
      startDate - Either a IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef or a BeforeUpgradeDBFunction that evaluates to date or timestamp.
      endDate - Either a IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef or a BeforeUpgradeDBFunction that evaluates to date or timestamp.
      Returns:
      datediff function for the given start and end dates

    • DatePart

      public static IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction DatePart(DatePart datePart, IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn column)
      Returns a DatePart function.
      Parameters:
      datePart - What DatePart to extract.
      column - Column from which to extract
      Returns:
      function which returns integer value of date part. See DatePart for details
